Array: Player: Justin Waye|Justin's Job|Justin Followed the Rules|Justin's Meeting|Justin's Planned Robbery|Justin's Planned Robbery 2
Before you even realized what you were doing,[p/] you threw a punch straight into Gavin's face.
Your eyes are slowly tearing up.[p/] You can only see red.
You grab Gavin by the collar and pull his face close to yours.
Tyrion: Get.[p/][p/][p/] The [i]hell[/i].[p/][p/][p/] Away from my house.
Gavin: Oh?![p/][s/] You want to go?!
Wyatt: Ha![p/] If you came looking for trouble,[p/] you sure found it.
Celeste: U-[p/]Um...[p/] Okay.[p/] Let's [i]all[/i] calm down and just-.
Gavin: Stay out of this, you little shit!
Gavin: What?![p/][s/] You got cotton in your ears or something?!
Celeste: Why don't you go and repeat what you said?
Tyrion: ...I'm sorry for losing my temper back there.
Tyrion: I...[p/] didn't mean to drag you into this.
Celeste: It's okay.[p/] Our emotions get the better of us sometimes.
Tyrion: I think you [i]might[/i] have overdone it a bit.
Tyrion: I don't think he's breathing.
Celeste: Come on.[p/] Just give him a second.
You suddenly hear the very bruised and broken form of Gavin sputtering and wheezing on the ground.
It looks like he's finally regained consciousness.
Wyatt is staring wide-eyed at Celeste.
From the shaking of his legs,[p/] it looks like he wants to run away.[p/] But he's too frozen by fear to move.
Celeste: Don't bother running.[p/] Even with a head start,[p/] I can easily catch up to you.
Celeste: Anyways,[p/] these two are probably Justin's former "delinquent friends", right?
Celeste: ...Are you okay with talking to them?
With your emotions in such disarray,[p/] you completely forgot why you came here in the first place.
Tyrion: ...Would you two happen to know the young man who died at the refinery yesterday?
Wyatt: ...! [mind="These guys are after Justin?! But he's already dead!"/]
"After Justin"?[p/] Was there someone with a grudge against him?
Wyatt clearly thinks that you were sent on someone's behalf.
It wouldn't hurt to play the part to get more information out of him.
Tyrion: We're not going to hurt you.
Tyrion: ...We're not going to hurt you [i]anymore[/i].
Tyrion: We'd just like to ask you a few questions about Justin.
Wyatt: Y-[p/]Yeah![p/][s/] S[p/][s/]-sure, man![p/][s/] Whatever you want!
Celeste: I'll work on popping Gavin's shoulder back into place.
It's a little disturbing how nonchalantly she says things like that.
You clutch the note tightly in your hands as you read it.
"There were so many things that I wanted to tell you.[p/] So many things that I wanted to show you."
"But I'm afraid that I can't do that now..."
"I need you to be strong now."
"This world is bleak,[p/] merciless,[p/] and unforgiving."
"But I've seen you.[p/] I know how bright the light within you is."
"Use my eyes.[p/] Peer beyond the Divine Gate as I once did."
Tyrion: Her "eyes"...?[p/] I...[p/][s/] I don't understand!
...It doesn't matter.[p/] All you have to do is stop the execution.
If you can just distract the knights long enough,[p/] you can save her and run away.
You'll have to abandon your home...[p/] But at least she'll still be with you.
As you try to sprint towards the gallows,[p/] a knight grabs your arm and pulls you back.
Knight: Hey, kid.[p/] You can't cross this point.
You fruitlessly try to break his grip by striking him with your bare hands.
But he barely feels anything through his armor.
You continue delivering blow after blow to him,[p/] but it does nothing.
Irritated by your behavior,[p/] the knight pins you to the ground.
You desperately struggle against him to no avail.
And from this position,[p/] you have no choice but to watch what's happening.
You make eye contact with your mother one last time.
Her body goes limp.[p/] You stare blankly at the hanging body.
You clutch her note tightly in your hand.
You feel a comforting yet fleeting warmth from it.
You snap back awake.[p/] It was another nightmare...
You notice that tears are streaming down your face.
You quickly try to bring up your sleeve to wipe them away.
...But you realize that Celeste is firmly gripping your hand.
Celeste: Um...[p/] You were...[p/] shouting in your sleep.
Celeste: But you seemed to calm down a little whenever I held your hand.
Celeste: So...[p/] I've been...[p/] doing that.
Celeste: You've been acting weird since we arrived in Aurinax.
Celeste: ...Does it have something to do with your mother?
Celeste: For the past two nights,[p/] you've been calling out for her in your sleep.
Celeste: Please.[p/] Just talk to me.
You didn't have many people in your life after you left Aurinax.
You only had Ms. Tymora.[p/] And she never wanted to talk about what happened...
But Celeste,[p/] she's been there since you started your career.
Tyrion: ...It all happened a long time ago.
Tyrion: We lived here together in that old house.
Tyrion: My mother was a merchant...[p/] and a mage.
Celeste: Your mother was a mage?
Tyrion: But I guess the gift of magic skipped my generation...[p/] [i]I[/i] could never use it.
Tyrion: ...About ten years ago,[p/] my mother's business partner was found murdered.
Tyrion: And they found traces of magic at the crime scene...
Celeste: They thought that your mom did it...
Tyrion: Ms. Tymora was my mother's defense attorney for the trial.
Tyrion: She did everything she could to get her acquitted.
Tyrion: ...But she could never find the real culprit.
Tyrion: They found her guilty of first-degree murder.
Tyrion: I tried to stop her execution...[p/] But...
Tyrion: Coming back here has brought back so many memories.
Tyrion: I thought...[p/] that I'd already moved on from what happened.
Tyrion: If I could just keep saving people as an attorney,[p/] then maybe I could put all of this behind me.
Tyrion: But I'm back in Aurinax...[p/] And those feelings are still so fresh in my mind.
Tyrion: It's like I'm still the same powerless child from ten years ago.
Tyrion: I know that I've been taking that out on you.
Celeste: Don't be...[p/] I get it.
Celeste: I know what it's like to lose someone like that.
Celeste: When my dad was murdered,[p/] you were there for me.
Celeste: If it weren't for you,[p/] I wouldve still believed that he died hating me.
Celeste slowly clasps your hand within hers again.
Has this been the warmth you've been feeling for the last few nights?
Celeste: So,[p/] just let me be here for you.
You can feel yourself dozing off.[p/] You have to snap yourself back awake.
Tyrion: S-[p/]Sorry.[p/] The last few days have been a little tiring.
Celeste: It's okay.[p/] Just focus on falling asleep.
Celeste: I'll stay with you for as long as you need me to.
Celeste: ...I'm also feeling pretty tired, though.
Celeste: I'll just rest my eyes a bit...
For the first time since you arrived in Aurinax,[p/] you finally receive a good night's rest.
You wake up the next morning feeling well-rested.
You feel almost a little [i]too[/i] rested.
You feel really reluctant to leave the comfort of your bed.
You can feel your heart stop.
Celeste: Ugggggggh...[p/] What do you want?
Her eyes slowly open as she wakes from her equally restful sleep.
You both dart out of the bed.
Celeste: You...[p/][s/] seem to be doing better.
Tyrion: Y-Yeah...[p/][s/] Thank you for last...[p/][s/] night.
Aster: Hello?[p/][s/] Are you there, Mr. Cuthbert?!
Your soul nearly jumps out of your body.
You suddenly hear Aster's voice.[p/] And it's extremely loud.
You look around to see where he is,[p/] but he's nowhere to be found.
Aster: Ah...[p/] Thank the Scaled Lord.[p/] I've finally gotten through to you two.
Aster: I'm using a spell to speak with you right now.
Aster: I apologize for contacting you in this manner.[p/] But I was worried that something had happened to you two.
Tyrion: Anyways...[p/] What do you want at this time of day?
Aster: Mr. Cuthbert.[p/] It's 3:00 PM in the afternoon.
: 3:00 PM?![p/][s/] You missed the entire morning!
Aster: I hope everything's okay[p/] Did something happen?
Tyrion: A-[p/]Anyways,[p/] if it's already this late,[p/] we should head over to the refinery.
Celeste immediately power walks out of the room.
Aster: If you're heading to the refinery,[p/] do you mind if I meet with you two?
Aster: There's...[p/] something that I'd like to ask you.
Aster: Wonderful![p/][s/] I'll see you at the town square!
You quickly meet Aster in the town square while you walk to the refinery.
You and Celeste walk to your destination with purpose...[p/] a little [i]too[/i] much purpose.
It's almost as if you're both trying to distract yourselves from something.
Every time you make eye contact with Celeste,[p/] she quickly glances away.
Things are a little awkward.[p/] But you much prefer this over the tense mood between you two yesterday.
Tyrion: A-[p/]Anyways Aster,[p/] what was that spell you used earlier?
Tyrion: It let you speak with us without being there.
Aster: Oh, that?[p/] That was a [b]conjuration[/b] spell.[p/] It's called "[b]Send Message[/b]".
Tyrion: ...I just feel a little bit uneasy that you can just contact us out of the blue like that...
More importantly,[p/] you're a little worried about what he might have [i]seen[/i].
Aster: D-[p/]Don't worry.[p/] The spell is perfectly harmless.
Aster: I can give you the parameters if you'd like.
Hm...[p/] It looks like it only facilitates communication.
He definitely didn't see the embarrassing state that you two were in.
Celeste: By the way...[p/] I'm not trying to be rude...[p/] But...
Celeste: Why are you following us?
Aster: I was still trying to think of the proper method to ask you...
Aster: B-[p/]But,[p/] you both seem to be on edge at the moment...
Tyrion: What did you want to ask us?
Aster: You already told me about the traces of [b]transmutation[/b] at the refinery.
Aster: But the trial yesterday really highlighted the significance of that.
Aster: I can't simply stand by if I was a witness to a murder...
Aster: ...May I join you on your investigation?!
You're questioning his motives...[p/] for a [i]variety[/i] of reasons...
He was the only other mage that was at the scene of the crime...
And between him and Rika,[p/] you definitely trust Rika more.
Tyrion: Alright,[p/] I see no reason why not.
Celeste shoots you a concerned look.[p/] You subtly gesture for her to keep an eye on Aster.
Aster is your prime suspect right now.[p/] And he [i]has[/i] to be aware of that.
But if you keep him close to you,[p/] you might catch some dissonant thoughts through the Eye.
Tyrion: Well[p/] It's been nice catching up with you, Rika.
Tyrion: ...But, I think it's time for us to get going.
Celeste: What?![p/][s/] But we just got here!
Mosourika: It's okay.[p/] I'm sure you're pretty busy nowadays.
Mosourika: I won't keep you any longer.
Mosourika: But be sure to write, okay?
Mosourika: Don't just go and disappear like last time.
Tyrion: Yeah...[p/] I'll stay in touch.
You exit the caf and make your way to the local merchant's guild to rent a carriage.
The city streets seem a bit more crowded than usual.[p/] It's a little difficult to make your way through them.
Celeste is fidgeting with her hands.
She looks like she wants to say something.[p/] But every time she starts to speak,[p/] she quickly stops herself.
This happens a few more times before she seems to give up.
You both continue to walk silently as you make your way to the merchant's guild.
As you make your way there,[p/] the streets become more and more crowded.
You hope the traffic won't interfere with the ride home.
Celeste: Hi,[p/] could we rent a carriage for travel to Ratholme?
Merchant: Sorry,[p/] but travel outside of the city is temporarily closed.
Merchant: Haven't you heard?[p/] The knights of the Kingsguard have locked down the city.
Merchant: They set up a blockade and everything.
Merchant: Check the city gates if you don't believe me.
As you arrive at the city gates,[p/] you see the blockade that the merchant was talking about.
A crowd of disgruntled townsfolk are angrily shouting at the knights stationed there.
Noblewoman: How long do you plan on keeping us here?!
Knight: Sorry,[p/] but we have our orders.
Knight: We can't let [i]anyone[/i] outside of the city until our investigation is complete.
Tyrion: Can you at least tell us what's going on?[p/] Why is the entire city being blockaded?
Knight: Sorry, sir.[p/] We're not allowed to release that information.
Knight: You'll just have to make other arrangements while we sort this out.
Knight: ...Actually,[p/] I haven't seen you two around before.
Knight: I'll need to take down your names and occupations for our records.
Tyrion: It's fine, Celeste...[p/] We're better off just cooperating with them.
It's an invasion of privacy...[p/] But you'd rather not resist orders from the Kingsguard.
Tyrion: I'm Tyrion Cuthbert.[p/] I'm a defense attorney.
You look over to the other Kingsguard.[p/] They seem to be taking notes of the people here too.
They must be making a list of everyone inside the city.
Nobleman: I have an important engagement tomorrow!
Nobleman: What am I supposed to do now?!
Noblewoman: This can't possibly be legal!
The townsfolk continue shouting at the knights.
But it's clear they won't be budging any time soon.
Celeste: Ugh...[p/] What do we do now?
You notice that it's starting to get late.
Tyrion: We don't know how long the city will be blockaded.
Tyrion: ...We should find a place to stay overnight, just in case.
You walk into a nearby tavern and see it absolutely crowded with patrons.
Celeste: Looks like everyone else had the same idea.
Merchant: Hey,[p/] welcome to the Aegwyn Tavern.
Merchant: What can I do for you?
Tyrion: Could we get two rooms for the night?
Merchant: ...Sorry,[p/] I can't even spare [i]one[/i] room.
Merchant: We're completely full with the blockade and all.
Celeste: Wait...[p/] Let me take care of this.
Celeste takes out a large pouch of gold and plops it on the innkeeper's desk.
Merchant: Well, would you look at that!
Merchant: One of our rooms just opened up!
Merchant: Hey,[p/] the entire city's locked down.
Merchant: Even [i]with[/i] your gold,[p/] that's the best I can do for you.
Celeste: What?[p/] Embarrassed to share a room with me, Tyrion?
You realize that she's just teasing you like she usually does.[p/] Best not to give it any mind.
Celeste: Oh.[p/] I was just kidding before.
Celeste: You can have the bed.[p/] I'll just sleep on the floor.
Tyrion: W-What?![p/][s/] I can't just let you-!
Celeste: Please,[p/] we may both be commoners,[p/] but [i]you[/i] live a cushy life in the city.
Celeste: I'm a mercenary.[p/] I've lived on the road for years.
Celeste: I sleep like this all the time.
Tyrion: Alright...[p/] But tell me if you change your mind.
Justin: H-[p/][s/]Hey![p/] I didn't see you there...
Justin: H-[p/][s/]Hey![p/][s/] Watch it![p/][s/] Quit shoving me!
Justin: H-[p/][s/]Holy crap![p/][s/] Pull me up!
Justin: I can't hold on for much longer!
Lloyd: Agh![p/] You idiot![p/][s/] What are you doing?!
Lloyd: Grab his arm and pull him up!
Justin: What the hell are you doing?!
Lloyd: Your grip is too tight![p/] Stop that!
Lloyd: What happened?![p/] I should have been able to-
Lloyd: By the Scaled Lord...[p/] He fell in...
Lloyd: That's right![p/] I can still make this look like it was all [i]his[/i] fault!
You find yourself falling into a nightmare.
Ruby: I can't believe they made you watch...
Tyrion: ...Are you going to keep fighting them?
Your voice is quiet.[p/] Your question barely comes out as a whisper.
Tyrion: Are you going to keep fighting the nobility?
Ruby: I don't know if I can anymore.
Ruby: Today they showed me what they're truly capable of...
Ruby: I was nave.[p/] I thought that the truth would prevail,[p/] but
Ruby: I'm only one person.[p/] I can't do this alone anymore...
Tyrion: ...So you're just going to give up?!
Tyrion: You're the [i]only[/i] one who will fight against them!
Tyrion: If you're just going to give up, then...
Tyrion: Was my mother's death truly pointless?!
Tyrion: Teach me how to be like you.
Tyrion: You said that you can't do this alone anymore, right?
Tyrion: So[p/] teach me how to be a defense attorney!
Tyrion: I can [i]help[/i] you![p/][s/] We can fight them together!
Ruby: Tyrion[p/] You're just a child.[p/] I can't just-
Tyrion: I...[p/] don't have anything left...
Tyrion: Please just take me away from here...
You clutch your hand tightly,[p/] feeling the fading warmth of the final message that your mother left for you.
It's the last comforting memory you'll have of her.
...It's a memory that you'll never experience again.
After some confusion,[p/] you realize that it was all a dream.
You didn't have any trouble falling asleep,[p/] but your slumber was less than restful.
It's been a while since you've remembered that day.
...That's all the more reason to leave this city as soon as possible.
Celeste was wistfully staring out of the window,[p/] watching the rain.
Her head whips towards you when she realizes that you're awake.
Celeste: N-[p/]Nothing.[p/] It's nothing. [mind="He wasn't awake... was he?"/]
She doesn't seem keen on sharing.[p/] It'd be best not to pry.
Tyrion: ...Anyways,[p/] do you know if the city is still under lockdown?
Celeste: I-[p/]I haven't checked yet.[p/] I was waiting for you to wake up.
You go outside and check the city gates.
The blockade still hasn't disappeared.[p/] In fact,[p/] it looks like it's been fortified with even more knights.
Celeste: Looks like we can't leave yet.
Tyrion: They've even doubled down on the guards[p/] What's going on here?
You spot Rika in the distance as she calls out to you.
As soon as she sees you,[p/] she breaks out into a full sprint towards you.
She looks exhausted.[p/] Has she been looking for you in the rain?
Mosourika: T-[p/][s/]There was an accident at the Arcane Refinery last night!
Mosourika: One of my friends who worked there...[p/] He fell into a vat of chemicals.
Tyrion: Oh, Rika...[p/] I'm so sorry.
Tyrion: If there's anything I can do-
Mosourika: Lord von Sanctus is blaming the Dracogen Trading Company!
Mosourika: He's trying to charge the owner with criminal negligence!
Hm[p/] As the lord of this region,[p/] von Sanctus [i]would[/i] have a lot of leverage in a legal battle like this.
He must be using this accident as an opportunity to oust Dracogen from his territory.
Mosourika: Tyrion...[p/] You're a lawyer, aren't you?
Tyrion: I...[p/] don't think I can.
Tyrion: Rika,[p/] I specialize in homicide cases.[p/] And most of my clients are mages who've been charged with murder.
Tyrion: I've never even [i]tried[/i] a case like this before.
Tyrion: There isn't any magic involved.[p/] And there's no killer.
Tyrion: Don't worry.[p/] I'm sure that the Dracogen Trading Company knows plenty of qualified attorneys who can help.
Celeste: I'm not so sure about that.
Celeste: A lord from one of the four Pillar Families is pressing those charges.
Celeste: Do you honestly think anyone else will try to fight them on this?
...She has a point.[p/] There aren't many attorneys who will go against the nobility under [i]any[/i] circumstances.
The only ones who will do that are you and Ms. Tymora.
Tyrion: Alright...[p/] I'll see what I can do.
Tyrion: But please don't get your hopes up.
Tyrion: I have very little information to work with right now.
Tyrion: And to be perfectly honest,[p/] I'm really out of my element.
Mosourika: That's okay.[p/] I'm sure that Mr. Dracogen will take any help he can get.
Mosourika: He's the owner of the Dracogen Trading Company.
Mosourika: He should be at the old Arcane Refinery right now.
That must be the scene of the accident too.
It would probably be best to start your investigation there.
Mosourika: I've been away from the shop for too long.[p/] So I can't come with you.
Mosourika: But drop by the caf if there's anything I can do to help.
Tyrion: It's some kind of tarot card.
Mosourika: A customer must have accidentally left it here.
Mosourika: The Magician is associated with the power of transformation and manifestation.
Mosourika: And in its upright position,[p/] which is associated with the resourcefulness to harness one's inner potential.
Mosourika: It often symbolizes a person who possesses great skill,[p/] creativity,[p/] and mastery over their craft.
Tyrion: I never knew you knew about these things.
Mosourika: Ha![p/][s/] Of course, I do!
Mosourika: The power of the magician is the power to shape reality through the power of will!
Mosourika: Doesn't [i]that[/i] remind you of someone?
Tyrion: There are some barrels stacked in the corner here.
Tyrion: The table that we're sitting at seems relatively new.
Tyrion: Rika apparently had them custom-made by the local carpenter.
Tyrion: Rika seems to have decorated the entire caf with several plants and flowers.
Tyrion: The greens add a fresh and rustic ambiance to the restaurant.
Tyrion: There are artificery lights hanging from the ceiling.
Tyrion: They're apparently hooked up to an Arcane power grid.
Tyrion: There's a shelf full of drinks,[p/] mugs,[p/] cream,[p/] and sugar behind the restaurant counter.
Tyrion: This must be where they prepare coffee to be served.
Mosourika: Sorry,[p/] I wasn't [i]trying[/i] to lie to you...
Tyrion: It's okay.[p/] I'm assuming you had your reasons.
Tyrion: But I need to know where I can find Justin's old friends.
Mosourika: You probably know already.[p/] But a few years ago,[p/] Justin got involved with a local street gang.
Mosourika: They'd always hang around the beach area.
Mosourika: But one day,[p/] they discovered an abandoned house along the coastline.
Mosourika: And they started spending most of their time there...
Mosourika: That's probably where you'll find Justin's old friends.
Tyrion: So...[p/] [i]That's[/i] why you were being so secretive.
Tyrion: Don't be.[p/] You were just trying to look out for me, right?
Mosourika: ...Are you going to be okay?[p/] I can go there with you if you'd like.
Tyrion: No...[p/] It's okay.[p/] I'm sure you're busy with the caf right now.
Tyrion: And it's not as if I'll be going alone.
Mosourika: Alright...[p/] Just don't push yourself too hard, okay?
Player: Why were you at the refinery?
Tyrion: By the way,[p/] why [i]were[/i] you at the refinery that day?
Tyrion: Didn't you have to work at the caf?
Mosourika: I was making a food delivery to Justin.
Celeste: Wait...[p/] You were delivering food [i]to[/i] the victim?
Mosourika: Yeah...[p/] He never had the time to make his own dinner.
Mosourika: So, I always delivered his dinner during his evening break.
Mosourika: But that night,[p/] I couldn't find him in the freight area.[p/] So I went looking for him in the refinery building.
Tyrion: So,[p/] the accident happened while you were delivering his food.
Tyrion: Did you talk to Justin at all before the accident?
Mosourika: I did.[p/] When I finally found him in the refinery building,[p/] he seemed busy.
Mosourika: He told me to leave his food in the break room.
He was busy?[p/] But according to Dracogen,[p/] he should have never been in the refinery building in the first place.
Celeste: Did he say what he was busy with?
Mosourika: He said that he had a meeting scheduled with Mr. Dracogen.
That can't be true, though...[p/] Dracogen didn't mention anything about this.
Tyrion: We've gotten a few witness accounts already.[p/] But I just wanted to double-check.
Tyrion: What did you see during the accident?
Tyrion: Sorry,[p/] I'm sure that it was a disturbing sight.
Tyrion: Do you need to take a moment?
Mosourika: It happened after Justin told me to leave his food in the break room.
Mosourika: It was my first time inside the refinery.[p/] So, I spent some time looking at all of the machines.
Mosourika: That's when I suddenly heard a strange sound from the walkway.
Mosourika: When I looked to see what it was,[p/] I saw Justin fall from there.
Mosourika: I tried to find someone to help him.[p/] But no one could hear me because of how loud the machines were.
Mosourika: Before I finally got them to understand what happened,[p/] it was already too late...
Tyrion: Did you see the guard rail break when Justin fell off of the walkway?
Tyrion: More specifically,[p/] did it break from Justin's weight?
Mosourika: I was too busy trying to find help.
You have matching witness accounts from Aster and Morrison.[p/] They saw the guard rail break.
Having Rika also confirm that would have been helpful.
But you suppose Aster and Morrison's statements will have to suffice.
Tyrion: Could you tell us more about the victim?
Tyrion: What kind of person was he?
Mosourika: He was a good person.
Mosourika: He fell in with a bad crowd a few years ago.[p/] But he was starting to turn his life around.
Mosourika: I saw how much he was trying to change.[p/] So I asked Mr. Dracogen to give him a job.
Mosourika: I really wanted to help him change his life for the better.
Mosourika: ...But this job just ended up killing him.
Celeste: You can't blame yourself for this.
Celeste: No one could have known that this would happen.
Mosourika: It's hard not to think about, though.
Tyrion: ...Was he the type of person to go places that he wasn't supposed to be?
Mosourika: He really wanted to make a good impression on Mr. Dracogen.
Mosourika: He always talked about following the rules.
Mosourika: He even got mad at me a few times when I accidentally broke Dracogen's protocols.
Right,[p/] that matches up with what Dracogen said.
But maybe he was falling back into his old habits.
Perhaps Rika can tell you more about what he was like [i]before[/i] he turned his life around.
Tyrion: You mentioned that Justin fell in with a "bad crowd" before.
Tyrion: I've also heard that he used to hang out with a band of local delinquents.
Tyrion: Could you tell us more about them?
Tyrion: Rika,[p/] this information will help us with our investigation.
